rukus.text: We settled the Children of Israel in a beautiful dwelling-place, and provided for them sustenance of the best. It was after knowledge had been granted to them that they fell into disagreements, indeed God will judge between them as to the disagreements among them, on the Day of Accountability
If you are in doubt as to what We have revealed to you, then ask those who have been reading the Book before you. The truth has indeed come to you from your Lord. So be in no way of those in doubt
Nor be among those who reject the signs of God, or you will become one of those who perish
Those whom the word of your Lord, predicted would refuse to believe
Even if every sign was brought to them, until they see the terrible penalty

Why was there not a single township that believed? Its faith would have profited it. Except the people of Jonah, when they believed, We removed from them the penalty of disgrace in the life of the present, and permitted them much enjoyment
If it had been your Lord’s will, they would all have believed, all who are on earth. Will you then compel the people against their will to believe
No soul can believe, except by the will of God, and He will place doubt on those who do not wish to understand
Say, “Behold, all that is in the heavens and on earth,” but neither signs nor warners profit those who believe not
Do they then expect anything other than what happened in the days of people who passed away before them? Say, “Then wait, I will wait with you.”
In the end, We deliver Our messengers and those who believe. Thus, it is fitting on Our part that We should deliver those who believe
